citeinfo.origin: Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (APSDP), formerly ACASIAN or Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network
citeinfo.title: Railroad Stations - North Korea

descript.abstract: A point coverage which represents railroad (railway) stations throughout North Korea. Stations are named in Hangul (the Korean syllabary) and in Unofficial, Official, and Yale romanization systems, and often have names identical to nearby settlements. Railroard routes appear in a separate coverage (Railroads - North Korea).
descript.purpose: This transportation data layer documents the railway stations along railroads throughout North Korea. Applications, such as the exploration of the development of transportation routes and networks and its correlation to key urban growth processes, will be of use to urban and regional planners, policy and decision-makers, earth scientists, and global change researchers. These data are intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and to provide users with geographic data for cartographic, environmental monitoring, management and impact analysis, economic analysis and other types of geographic analysis. These data can be used with geographic information systems (GIS) software to display and analyze information on transportation and associated areas of interest, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
descript.supplinf: Data originally supplied in ARC/INFO 7.2 export format (.e00), and are projected in decimal degrees using the WGS84 Spheroid/Datum.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to licensee (Harvard University) only.

cntaddr.address: School of International Business & Asian Studies

idinfo.datacred: Spatial data produced at the Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (formerly known as the Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network, ACASIAN) under the direction of Lawrence W. Crissman. Copyright Griffith University.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 6; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

attracc.attraccr: The names of populated places, administrative regions, railroad stations, and others are provided in Hangul (Korean syllabary), Unofficial romanization, Official romanization and in the Yale romanization system in their respective attribute tables. Nodes that mark rail intersections are not coded. Those that represent stations are coded with .Sxx appended to the four digit administrative codes for the ADM2 units in which they are contained (as in xxyy.S01, xxyy.S2, etc.) The station nodes are also named, in Hangul (the Korean syllabary) and in Unofficial, Official, and Yale romanization systems, and often have names identical to nearby settlements.

procstep.procdesc: The original shape file was imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: ESRI Shapefile. Points represent rail stations

attr.attrdef: The SHAPE attribute defines the vector data as either a point, polyline, or polygon.

edom.edomvd: A point represents a single location, usually identified by longitude-latitude, on the earth's surface
